name: Linux
description: An open-source operating system kernel widely used in servers, desktops, and embedded systems.

name: PostgreSQL
description: A powerful open-source relational database system known for reliability and extensibility.

name: Docker
description: A platform to develop, ship, and run applications inside lightweight containers.

name: Kubernetes
description: An orchestration system for automating deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications.

name: Nginx
description: A high-performance web server and reverse proxy used for load balancing and caching.

name: Git
description: A distributed version control system for tracking changes in source code.

name: Angular
description: A TypeScript-based web application framework maintained by Google.

name: ASP.NET Core
description: A cross-platform framework for building modern cloud-based web applications with .NET.

name: Redis
description: An in-memory key-value store often used for caching and real-time analytics.

name: ElasticSearch
description: A distributed search and analytics engine commonly used for log and text analysis.

name: Prometheus
description: An open-source monitoring and alerting toolkit optimized for time-series data.

name: Grafana
description: An observability platform for visualizing metrics, logs, and traces.

name: Terraform
description: An infrastructure as code tool for provisioning and managing cloud resources declaratively.

name: Ansible
description: An automation tool for configuration management, application deployment, and orchestration.

name: OpenWrt
description: A Linux-based open-source firmware for embedded devices, especially routers.

name: Debian
description: A stable and community-driven Linux distribution that serves as the base for many others.

name: Ubuntu
description: A Linux distribution based on Debian, popular for desktops, servers, and cloud deployments.

name: CentOS Stream
description: A Linux distribution that sits between Fedora and Red Hat Enterprise Linux, serving as a rolling preview.

name: Podman
description: A daemonless container engine that is compatible with Docker CLI.

name: Vault
description: A tool for securely storing and controlling access to secrets and sensitive data.

name: CI/CD
description: A set of practices for continuous integration and continuous delivery of software.

name: Agile
description: A methodology emphasizing iterative development, collaboration, and flexibility.

name: Scrum
description: An agile framework for managing work with defined roles, events, and artifacts.

name: Kanban
description: A workflow visualization method that uses boards to optimize throughput.

name: Microservices
description: An architectural style where applications are composed of loosely coupled services.

name: Monolith
description: An application design where all functionality is bundled into a single codebase.

name: Load Balancer
description: A system that distributes network or application traffic across multiple servers.

name: Firewall
description: A network security system that monitors and controls incoming and outgoing traffic.

name: DNS
description: The Domain Name System, which resolves human-readable names into IP addresses.

name: TLS
description: Transport Layer Security, a cryptographic protocol providing secure communication over a network.
